Use: Initializes a new Git repository in the current directory.
Creates a copy of a remote repository on your local machine.
Adds changes in a file to the staging area.
Records changes staged for the next commit.
Shows the status of changes as untracked, modified, or staged.
Fetches changes from a remote repository and merges them into the current branch.
Pushes committed changes to a remote repository.
Lists all local branches, highlighting the current one.
Merges changes from the specified branch into the current branch.
Downloads changes from a remote repository without merging.
Removes a file from both the working directory and the Git repository.
Unstages changes in a file but preserves its content.
